meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characterized by philanthropy.
meanings.sent1: Her philanthropical efforts to help the homeless community were truly admirable.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman's philanthropical donations greatly impacted the local school.
meanings.sent3: The philanthropical cat donated all its extra food to the hungry kittens next door.
meanings.sent4: His philanthropical spirit shone brightly, illuminating the lives of those around him.
meanings.sent5: The philanthropical garden bloomed with flowers of kindness and generosity.

meanings.definition: Generously concerned for human welfare and advancement, usually manifested by donations of money, property, or work to needy persons, by endowment of institutions of learning and hospitals, and by generosity to other socially useful purposes.
meanings.sent1: The philanthropical family donated a large sum to support medical research.
meanings.sent2: Her philanthropical nature led her to volunteer at the local shelter every weekend.
meanings.sent3: The philanthropical squirrel shared its nuts with all the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: His philanthropical heart beat with the rhythm of giving and compassion.
meanings.sent5: The philanthropical sun warmed not only the earth but also the hearts of those in need.
